intro: Cieca discolor, commonly known as the spotted orchid, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive spotted leaves and delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its flowers are usually pale green or white with a subtle fragrance, attracting various pollinators. Cieca discolor is a perennial herb that thrives in temperate climates and is often found in association with other woodland flora.
